sentences.english: The bright colours on the wall caught our attention.
sentences.chinese: 牆壁上鮮豔的顏色吸引了我們的注意力。

sentences.english: Signals in the spectrum can penetrate walls, making it ideal for wireless broadband.
sentences.chinese: 該頻段的信號可以穿透牆壁，從而非常適合無線寬帶。

sentences.english: Can you knock the nail into the wall?
sentences.chinese: 你能把這個釘子敲進牆壁裏去嗎？

sentences.english: The scribbles on the wall must be the work of those children.
sentences.chinese: 牆壁上的塗鴉準是那幾個孩子畫的。

sentences.english: Painting originated in prehistoric times with murals drawn on cave walls.
sentences.chinese: 繪畫始於史前時期洞穴牆壁上的蹙畫。

sentences.english: The damp rising from the ground caused the walls to stain badly.
sentences.chinese: 地面上升起的潮氣使牆壁的顏色變得很難看。

sentences.english: Use the battens of two by one inches and steel nails for nailing to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 由一個使用條板二移動和釘牢的鋼釘子對牆壁。

sentences.english: Drill for drilling wall anchor holes.
sentences.chinese: 用於打鑽牆壁錨栓孔的電鑽。

sentences.english: The white wall was overworked with wallpaper.
sentences.chinese: 用牆紙裝飾的白色牆壁。

sentences.english: Another's bedroom is tilting.There are cracks on many of the walls.
sentences.chinese: 另一間臥室也已傾斜，牆壁上盡是裂隙。

sentences.english: Forget growth marks scratched in pencil on the kitchen wall.
sentences.chinese: 廚房牆壁上用鉛筆畫下的身高標記已經成爲歷史。

sentences.english: The peeling wall detract from the beauty of the room.
sentences.chinese: 脫皮的牆壁有損於這間房間的美。

sentences.english: You can even slip them into the wall to build a step shelf-like design.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以把它們插到牆壁裏變成一個階梯式的架子。

sentences.english: Not forget that the wall of the room a few obtrusive calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 忘不了房間牆壁上那幾個礙眼的毛筆字。

sentences.english: There was a large indentation on the far wall of the room.
sentences.chinese: 有在房間的遠牆壁上的一個大的壓痕。

sentences.english: Karnak temple site in Luxor, Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 斯特卡納神廟遺址，牆壁滿位老壁。

definition: drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
